result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa L. Dombrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may have early discharge from probation any time after 1 year if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes:
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle. 
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not enter into or loiter near any establishment where the main purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, including liquor stores. 
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes, without a valid prescription.

Any Assessments and Counseling as recommended by DOC. 
The defendant must continue with the Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system for another 6 weeks.  Court does allow Defendant to have a Patch Alcohol Monitoring system installed. Shall comply with all rules established by the vendor. Shall not remove or otherwise tamper with the Patch Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system without court approval.  The Patch Transdermal Alcohol Monitoring system may only be removed by the vendor. 
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided. 
ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN THIS CASE WILL BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CALUMET COUNTY CLERK OF COURT OFFICE AND NOT YOUR PROBATION AGENT.  Probation Agent is responsible to monitor ongoing payments to make sure all obligations are paid as a part of probation conditions.
If financial obligations are not paid monthly based on the payment plant that was set up and you are delinquent for more than 60 days, a civil judgment shall be entered against you for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect this debt, including sending unpaid obligations to the State Debt Collection Agency.
